intro: Secamone vestita, commonly known as the naked secamone, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four petals and a tubular corolla. The fruit is a capsule that contains several small, dark seeds.
